docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, April 27. -- Thirteen American nations, including the United States, signed the Argentine anti-war pact, of which Foreign Minister Carlos Saavedra Lamas is the author, at a ceremony at the Government House this afternoon. Only Peru and...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, April 27. -- Thirteen American nations, including the United States, signed the Argentine anti-war pact, of which Foreign Minister Carlos Saavedra Lamas is the author, at a ceremony at the Government House this afternoon. Only Peru and the Dominican Republic have not signed.
docs.abstract: S at signing of anti-war pact by 13 nations

headline.main: 13 NATIONS ADHERE TO ANTI-WAR PACT; Ceremony at Buenos Aires Pledges to Peace All but 2 American Countries. CHACO BELLIGERENTS SIGN Author of Treaty Says Bolivia and Paraguay Realize Arms Cannot Settle Disputes.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Colonel John S. Hammond and a group of associates have acquired control of the famous sports arena, Madison Square Garden, it was announced yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Colonel John S. Hammond and a group of associates have acquired control of the famous sports arena, Madison Square Garden, it was announced yesterday.
docs.abstract: J S Hammond and associates acquire control; formal statement; plans

headline.main: HAMMOND'S GROUP ACQUIRES GARDEN; Gains Control by Purchase of 78,000 Shares Held by Hoyt Interests.

docs.snippet: PHILADELPHIA, May 6. -- Fascism, communism and nazism were accused today by Miss Cornelia M. Van Asch Van Wyck of Holland, world head of the Young Women's Christian Association, of having "chosen the cheap and easy way of great promises for actual...
docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA, May 6. -- Fascism, communism and nazism were accused today by Miss Cornelia M. Van Asch Van Wyck of Holland, world head of the Young Women's Christian Association, of having "chosen the cheap and easy way of great promises for actual life which cannot be fulfilled."
docs.abstract: Explains widening of basis for membership in YWCA

headline.main: NAZISM IS DECRIED AT Y.W.C.A. SERVICE; It, With Fascism and Communism, Tricks Youth With 'Great Promises,' Says World Head.
